website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for a streaming box that not only does Blu-ray movies but also plays games, then the Sony BDP-S5500 is an absolute bargain.
pros: The Sony BDP-S5500 Blu-ray player offers excellent picture quality in a compact package
Streaming media is the prime focus, and users can assemble shortcuts the way they like for the first time on a Sony player
The ability to play PlayStation Now games is a bonus
cons: Compared with a Roku, the Sony is slow to load streaming apps
There are no display or playback controls on the unit itself

customer_reviews.title: Sony disappointed me.
customer_reviews.text: Returning it. I have VIZIO tv. I was not able to play any DVD on this as said in the manual. I played only one blu ray movie. I never could get HOME screen to enter in the settings. I keep getting "Not Support!" messsage on my TV. (yes SUPPORT not supported! ;-) ) I contacted their support and they said this product needs servicing. I googled and found similar problem by some other people. Sony disappointed me.
customer_reviews.author: MathLover

customer_reviews.title: It's just a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for a while now it seems to never let me steam a show straight through with out the unit freezing up to a point I have to unplug it to turn it off and back on.... About to throw this thing against the wall. If you are looking to stream just get an amazon fire stick or roku. This thing isn't worth the headache it causes. Shame on Sony. The least they can do is update it to fix the problems.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Skaggs

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time.
customer_reviews.text: Wow. This thing is nearly useless. The apps on it suck. Netflix locks so consistently that I had to buy another roku for the living room. And it does even do the job of playing DVD well. It locks up doing that way to often. And that's its primary job! Definitely would not buy this again. Not even en sure I'd take one for free.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Plug it in, spin up a movie, enjoy
customer_reviews.text: This player is small, loads fast, and has had zero issues. The wifi connected perfectly and updates are executed without problem. The remote is easy enough to use, but like with other home theater devices, your best bet is a remote such as a Harmony. My main complaint with this device is the short cable. This is case by case specific as the short cable could benefit those that keep this in a comm closet; however, this issue is easily mitigated with an extension cable. I have not really used the apps on the device so I cannot comment too much on those. Overall, I have been very pleased with this product and would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: EReviews

customer_reviews.title: Instructions for setting things up were not the best. Had to do some trial and error to ...
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had a chance to try much except play discs. Instructions for setting things up were not the best. Had to do some trial and error to get the device connected to the internet. Haven't tried any of the streaming services yet. Biggest problem is when the device goes into sleep mode. There doesn't seem to be anyway of waking it up short of unplugging it and plugging it back in. I've seen others on the web dealing with this and have seen no good answers. Still in all, it seems to be a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Murray M. Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Wireless connection fails
customer_reviews.text: Within a couple of months it was taking longer and longer to connect to my wireless router. Now, it cannot connect at all. Tried everything to fix it. This basically turns the machine into a brick unless you want to run a wire all through your house.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Dearborn

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have used a lot of Sony products over the years and have always been impressed with their quality. Sadly, I can't say that about this device. If Sony is going to compete with Roku for streaming, they have a bit to get there. The reason I bought this was the convenience of connecting one device for BluRay/DVD and streaming. The downside is the apps are glitchey and limited from the Roku. Even after resetting the device and making sure it had current updates it is still glitchey. We needed to upgrade to BluRay so we will keep it, but probably go back to the Roku for streaming when finances allow.
customer_reviews.author: Richard A Moeller

customer_reviews.title: Short Ride
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a year and a half of VERY light use. 3D, blurays, DVDs worked fine prior to breakdown - was used maybe once or twice a quarter. Now it doesn't recognize disks of any format. Unplugged and changed outlet, confirmed firmware is latest, reset to default - still nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Jason G

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a year....then died
customer_reviews.text: Worked Fine....For A Year. Then it died a quiet and uneventful death. Went to turn it on one day and nothing. Dead. Put new batteries in the remote.... Read all troubleshooting information I could find online and nothing helped. Chucked it into the trash and dug out the out of date LG BP I've had for years and plugged it back in and hooked it up to the TV. Still works. Sony use to make good products. Not so sure about them now.
customer_reviews.author: Just Another Captain...

customer_reviews.title: Does a lot more than I thought
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an inexpensive replacement DVD player, but use the other features much more. It was easy to add to my wireless network (typing a WPA2 password with a remote control is a pain...). It can play YouTube and Netflix and has a great picture, despite moderate WiFi signal strength. My old setup required hitting a few buttons to make the video aspect match the television, but this player figures it out automatically very well. I haven't found much use for the additional channels/services.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beware of the remote
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, lightweight Blu-Ray player, and it is very cool that my iPhone can, via an easy app, be its remote. But I am very displeased that within two weeks of getting it, and barely five uses, the remote it comes with, a RMT-VB100u, is completely bricked. For no reason that I can see, it worked fine to turn on the player and select an app and get my program rolling, and then stopped responding at all, ever. I replaced the batteries repeatedly, and tried all the troubleshooting steps on the Sony website. (The Sony support people uselessly then directed me back to all the same troubleshooting steps.) So, great player, very unreliable remote.
customer_reviews.author: Bearwife

customer_reviews.title: Nice little item
customer_reviews.text: This is a review for a first time user. I have only had it 2 days but I love that I can watch my Amazon Prime on my non-smart TV. I have a concern that I cant press play on the unit. If I am wrong about this feature I haven't figured it out yet. I would have given it 5 stars if the remote lit up. Its very difficult to make selections without a illumination. This isn't just this items problem its an issue in general I think. I love its compact size.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Carole

customer_reviews.title: Nothing but problems
customer_reviews.text: I chose this model for the WiFi, but it kept dropping the signal. I contacted them about the problem through Amazon contact seller link. Troubleshooting did not work. The final answer was to just plug in the ethernet cable. No option for returns. A couple of weeks later a got a phone call telling me they would refund me. That didn't happen either.
customer_reviews.author: DouglasFish

customer_reviews.title: Works great, some details...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I've heard that Sony makes the best Blu-Ray players and I must admit, this player loads the discs much faster than our previous unit. The Smart aspect of works great too (we use it for Amazon Prime and Netflix). The outputs in back are limited. One HDMI and one digital RCA audio out. If you have an older TV, you may need to do some configuring to get it like you want it. One important note for those who stack components: This unit is tiny. It's smaller than our cable box.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Lots of issues with online services, now dead
customer_reviews.text: DVD player has a hard time connecting to the internet services. Every few times its powered on it has to be re-setup. When connecting to internet services is very slow or has a hard time connecting. For a stand along DVD player its fine. As of 10/2018, dead. No longer powers on. Now resting in the bottom of the garbage can.
customer_reviews.author: D. Tuers

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad - but Not Terribly Good either.
customer_reviews.text: So far, I haven't had as many problems w/this unit as many of the 1-star reviewers report, but my unit did recently start freezing after listening to a few tunes using the Pandora app. The only good news there is that the 'freeze-up' only seems to occur at the conclusion of a song - vs freezing in the middle of a song. Oddly, the player worked OK for me during the first few weeks - which was long enough to get Sony past the Amazon free return deadline. Bottom-lining: I'll think twice about it before buying another Sony streaming device.
customer_reviews.author: Maxster

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't be happier. The old Sony was moved to another TV ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I wanted to gain a wi-fi connection on my flat screen TV. The TV is old enough it's not wi-fi enabled, but much too new to replace. I was surprised at how small it is. It replaced the Sony blue ray I purchased at the same time as the TV & it's about 1/3 the size with a lot more functionality. It was so very simple to set up & connect to my internet. I couldn't be happier. The old Sony was moved to another TV that already has wi-fi built in, it won't go to waste. This was a simple, inexpensive solution that met my needs perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Michele A Frost

customer_reviews.title: This was an amazing buy. I needed a smaller BR player - ...
customer_reviews.text: This was an amazing buy. I needed a smaller BR player - My other audio units are much wider. The quality is just as good as an older Panasonic BR Player that cost 3 times this price. The functionality is awesome.. Would tell anyone that this is the unit to buy. You need to hit the display button to see where you are on a movie but that is a no brainer. Blu Ray discs are still the way to go. TV cable inputs just cannot duplicate the picture quality or sound. Sony hit a home run on this one.
customer_reviews.author: History Buff

customer_reviews.title: Why not 5 stars?
customer_reviews.text: 1. Play blu-ray disks perfectly - check. 2. Support 3d - check. 3. Upsample and conversion DVD and DTS - check. 4. Most streaming apps DON'T work correctly -uncheck. 5. Monthly fee for games you already own - uncheck. The hardware and design are fine, but Sony needs to invest in the software. #4 is a problem across their product line (I also have a Bravia 850). Why not just hire an elite 5 person engineering team (3 dev, 1 qa, 1 qa + coordinator) to polish each implementation before calling it final?
customer_reviews.author: Eco Pragmatist

customer_reviews.title: bad programming on this player. don't buy.
customer_reviews.text: totally unsatisfied. the coding inside the machine was worthless. i should not have to reboot the bluray to change between tv and streaming and playing the bluray. never had a player like this in all my machines i have owned. returned it and will need to rethink Sony purchases.
customer_reviews.author: renazantz

customer_reviews.title: As I had it replaced once with the same unit I couldn't believe I got two bad ones and thought I had network problems and went .
customer_reviews.text: I have tried and tried to make this thing work with no luck. As I had it replaced once with the same unit I couldn't believe I got two bad ones and thought I had network problems and went round and round with that. Today I finally went and bought a Samsung player that works fine on my network. This is the last Sony product I'll buy. I hope Amazon will take it back after all this time. Please advise !!
customer_reviews.author: William Pease

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this DVD Player for its Wi-Fi Capability
customer_reviews.text: This unit plays DVDs, Blu-ray, etc. fine. However, I bought it mainly for its wi-fi capability. Unfortunately, it is not very good for wi-fi. The wi-fi reception is poor and the whole process of getting into, say, Netflix, is slow and laborious. Use the amazon Alexa device if you want to stream movies..
customer_reviews.author: RJG

customer_reviews.title: Great Player, but With Volume Issues?
customer_reviews.text: This is a great and compact device, it's roughly a foot square. It has full network capabilities, and the ability to play media via USB. The only issue I've had, and it may be because of my setup, is that the volume is significantly lower on this device than any other. I typically have the volume around 20 - 25, but when playing through this, I have to turn it up to 35-40. It plays Netflix and playstation network, as well as several other apps, and is updatable online. It's well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Christophe A Cole

customer_reviews.title: Extremely capable player at a great price
customer_reviews.text: PROS: Quickly loads Blu-Ray disc, zero issues during playback. Numerous apps available. Wired and wifi enabled. DLNA enabled, detected my media server on first use. Compact. CONS: Sometimes slow to respond to remote control, or may not respond on first try. I mainly use this for watching discs, Netflix, listening to Pandora and streaming local content from my media server, but this player is loaded with many other features that I haven't tried yet. For those functions which I do use this, it works flawlessly. When playing discs, picture quality is not noticeably different from my older Samsung player.
customer_reviews.author: John B.

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Replacement for player that went out.Plugged in and setup works perfect.Setup is easy on these players.,Player went out again no more sony anything.What junk they have started to sell.Update.Ok I had ordered 2 of these and both have now went out.Talked to support center and of course the old unplug and replug and hold this button down and this will reset the unit....It did and worked for 1 day then right back to the unplug and replug and reprogram everything.No more Sony ever.Both are now resting peacefully in the dumpster as the warranty is over from Amazon and Sony will not take them back.
customer_reviews.author: J.Blook

customer_reviews.title: For some reason it will not play some AVI files that play fine on my computer reason for missing one start and ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for spare bedroom and it seems to function ok for the features it has. For some reason it will not play some AVI files that play fine on my computer reason for missing one start and in comparing it to my Samsung DVD/receiver unit it does not have the ability to zoom on pictures and then scroll as my Samsung does. May seem like small item but it is handy when viewing pictures of Europe. So it is just OK for me. I am looking for another similar unit for downstairs and so for those reason am leaning toward Samsung.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Urquhart

customer_reviews.title: it is either I am very unlucky or sony needs to do a better job manufacturing its products
customer_reviews.text: I have used this device twice. Now it is frozen. The Off/On button and the Open/Close button do not work. Therefore, the remote is not working either. I will never buy sony stuffs anymore since I already go through two Sony Vaio computer. it is either I am very unlucky or sony needs to do a better job manufacturing its products. The good thing is that it is under warranty and sony is going to replace it. Waste of my time.
customer_reviews.author: Just Beautiful

customer_reviews.title: The perfect find
customer_reviews.text: We LOVE our Sony Blu-Ray Player - it easily connects to our Wi-Fi AND comes with its own apps that allow you to watch videos and movies like TED Talks, The Good Witch (movie) and more! I could not believe everything it came with for the price we purchased it at...in fact, I wish I had purchased two! It's small and compact and the video looks great on our 50 inch television. I haven't been able to put the 3D into use yet, but I do have a 3D blu-ray disc that I can use once we do want to try it. If this ever becomes available again - I will snatch it up.
customer_reviews.author: Felicia L. Jiardina

customer_reviews.title: Done with Sony.
customer_reviews.text: Crap. 2-3 months after purchase, it wouldn't play Blu-rays anymore; now, 5 months after purchase, it's 50-50 on whether it will play DVDs. Now, I have to deal with sending out in to be "refurbished" or replaced, go without for however long, and see how long their next piece of garbage lasts. I'm a smoker, which I understand can be problematic for the optics, but I never smoke in the room where the machine is and I use a disc cleaner regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Barth

customer_reviews.title: Good basic unit, does what it's supposed to
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for an older Panasonic player that didn't read some of my discs and took forever to load. The player is quite a bit smaller, not as sturdy as the one it replaced, however it works fine. So far, it's read every disc I've put in and loads reasonably quickly. I don't use the streaming capability much since I have a Roku player, however I did try streaming and it works fine also. Good unit, very reasonably priced. Picture and sound quality is excellent as you expect with Blu-Ray.
customer_reviews.author: S. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Much better than last generation.
customer_reviews.text: Way better than the previous generation. I bought this latest player on a lark to try and improve overall performance over the BDP5200 and BDP3200. Both are plagued with freezing with hard restarts. So far with this new player, streaming quality is way better than the other models, no buffering, no freezes, no dropouts. Disk performance might be somewhat better as well, again vastly improved with no freezing and hard restarts needed. Overall design is better too.
customer_reviews.author: MoeJo JoeJoe

customer_reviews.title: Worked great (for awhile)
customer_reviews.text: Overall this unit is great.... when it works! And Sony is normally a top choice. Mine failed after 1.5 years, just out of warranty. Called Sony, and they did help with trouble shooting, but the unit did not respond. The farm out their service for products out of warranty. The minimum price for repair is over the price paid new, and if they don't fix it, there is still a charge. Totally unacceptable. I've purchased thousands of dollars in products from Sony, but I'm looking for another good quality vendor that offers SERVICE that doesn't exceed the value of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: L Smith

customer_reviews.title: Bitstream settings found
customer_reviews.text: The BDPS 5500 is not bad. I don't know why it does not play DTS Master Audio or Dolby True Audio on BluRay. They play on 3D movies. I am still deciding on whether to keep or not. 02.06.17 I finally started to dig into settings after owning for quite awhile. Simply setting the BD Audio Mix Setting to off and Audio DRC to On allows bitstream to my home receiver. That should be in the manual or I just didn't notice it, dummy. I just prefer my receiver decode DTS Master and Dolby True as a preference.
customer_reviews.author: Robwilli

customer_reviews.title: Streaming just doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: It's a fine blu-ray player, but if you're buying it for streaming capabilities, move on to a different device. It freezes, refuses to turn on or off, stoops mid-show or mid-movie, among other things. We end up pulling out a long HDMI cable and using my laptop to stream content to the TV - even all that hassle is easier than trying to use this player. Plus, it doesn't have HBO Now. I very much regret making this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Quite good for the price
customer_reviews.text: The functionality is good- I like being able to do Netflix with it. It reads my CDs consistently, though sometimes it's slow in recognizing what's going on. I had some issues getting it to work with a longer HDMI cable, though it was a very long cable. I wasn't able to get the SPDIF working right, but I wasn't sure if that was the fault of my old receiver or the blu ray player. I'm getting what I wanted out of it though, so it's worth at least three stars.
customer_reviews.author: J. Carrow

customer_reviews.title: The blue-ray part works fine but the Streaming leaves a lot to be desired
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a Roku but needed a blue-ray player so I gave this a try. The blue-ray part works fine but the Streaming leaves a lot to be desired. Amazon video is a real crap shoot with the Sony ... it works sometimes & not other times ...VERY inconsistent! I went ahead & bought a Roku 4 & the difference is astounding! Vid quality is night & day better with the Roku! In fact everything is better with the Roku! I decided to keep the BDPS5500 to play Blue-rays but if you need a good Streamer box don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Michael Niccum

customer_reviews.title: Shoddy workmanship!  Player stops working in LESS THAN FIVE MONTHS!
customer_reviews.text: I received my player in November of last year, and last week, it stopped working......REALLY???? In less than FIVE MONTHS, this product stopped working. There is no excuse for this kind of workmanship, and I am so very disappointed in SONY for allowing this player to have their name on it. I feel I am owed a replacement, but the "return window" expired with Amazon. Wow, can't believe this!
customer_reviews.author: SBS

customer_reviews.title: Sony DVD Player
customer_reviews.text: So much better than my previous player. Absolutely no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Edmond Rivera

customer_reviews.title: Freezes, needs to be unplugged etc.......
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the MLB streaming app. Worked alright for 35 days or so now streaming doesn't work consistently regardless of location of router. Freezes, has to be unplugged at least once a day. I have also had a Blu-ray get stuck, had to unplug, wait, re-plug and presto. Setup is easy, its nice looking, great size but alas if it doesn't do its job......
customer_reviews.author: demburey

customer_reviews.title: Designed to Fail
customer_reviews.text: I'm not having much luck with electronics purchased from Amazon. I purchased this item in 2015 to transform an older model flat screen into a smart tv. While barely using the product, this, like my Amazon Fire 8, has failed. I'm no techy, so I called my local cable company for service, and the technician confirmed that the device was malfunctioning. I think I'll return to ordering electronic items at a local big box.
customer_reviews.author: ROBERT WEST

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Unit
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a 3 year old Blue-ray player with this unit. Sony has a captured my business! This unit rocks... think DVD / Blue-ray and Smart TV rolled into one small, compact, easy to use unit! The Smart TV APPS... have replaced my Roku unit... Especially like the HDMI output and choice of wired (Cat5e) or wireless internet connectivity. I am using the wired internet connectivity and have experience zero problems. Excellent unit! Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Jim P01

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, Great Price, Great Apps (Opera Browser Excluded)
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to setup and use. Apps work like a charm. I would NOT recommend this product if you are looking to surf the web with it. The built in browser (Opera) is horrible and has only worked for me twice. Much simpler to connect my laptop to my TV. But everything else on this Blu-ray player functions great. I really like how when you insert a disc it will automatically switch my TV's input to the Blu-ray's HDMI channel. I don't have to change it with the TV remote. Great product at a very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Lee A. Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: I have had this item for sometime now and it is a good piece of equipment! It is slim and does not take up a lot of space. Even though it is a Blu-Ray player I like the fact I can play my regular DVDs on it. The Wi-Fi aspect is good too since I discontinued my very expensive cable. Good Purchase however I have not used the 3D aspect of this item.
customer_reviews.author: KHP

customer_reviews.title: Do not Recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on March 18, 2016. It is now March 31, 2017 and works when it wants to. Keeps freezing, stops movies all the time, makes a horrible vibrating sound at times. Not something I would recommend purchasing. I have it directly connected to the router and it stills say that wifi cannot connect and takes a long time to load things like amazon prime and netflix. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy

customer_reviews.title: First wi-fi unit - works great. Don't be afraid of the firmware update.
customer_reviews.text: This is our first blu-ray player and first wi-fi unit used to stream video. So far, we love it. It is simple enough for our kids to use and was easy to connect. Yes, we had to do the firmware update, but if you follow the directions, it was a piece of cake. I do wish typing was simpler, but no complaints otherwise. I would highly recommend this play if you want to stream video from Netflix, Prime or any other providers.
customer_reviews.author: C. Engelbrecht

customer_reviews.title: Player stopped working after only watching a few videos - buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: Player stopped working after only watching a few videos. I thought it was the power supply, but it just stopped working. Buyer beware! Buy something else, not this. Note: There are over 30 other people who have noted this issue.
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: SUPERIOR QUALITY & PERFORMANCE!  Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent buy! Superior product! Would recommend and buy again and again. In fact, I wish I had known about this before I made the mistake of buying the Samsung version of a similar product. The difference in the quality of the pic is unbelievable in this Sony compared to the Samsung. I don't have the model # handy, but the Samsung was around $83, curved, and had no indicator light on it. I sent it back, and am thrilled with this perfomance!
customer_reviews.author: Jo in AZ

customer_reviews.title: slow piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was just a slow machine but this thing will not continuously stream videos. it freezes multiple times in a sitting. I want to throw it out the window. I've updated it multiple times, and Ive had nothing but problems with it for 2 years. the Blu ray player is great but the streaming is crap. my other devices stream just fine but I must have gotten a lemon because this one sucks! i HATE this player! its the bane of my existance!
customer_reviews.author: Morganic

customer_reviews.title: Nice and simple
customer_reviews.text: I bought this just for playing 3D Blu-rays as I stream the rest of my media from another location, but it works great, has no trouble with the 3D Blu-rays, and my Harmony hub had no problems configuring to it. The device is no larger than necessary which is nice given how big some players are and how much wasted space they have inside them. This one is nice and compact with an appealing finish.
customer_reviews.author: Jon H

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Wanted
customer_reviews.text: The last stand-alone Blu-Ray player I bought (not including PS3s) was more than double in every way (cost, size, loading time). This little fella does everything I want it to: Quickly load & play movies, first and foremost. But it also has WiFi and connects to all of the apps. In that realm, we really only use Pandora, but there's a ton of available apps. Affordable and does what it should. Great picture. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: TPBayAMZN

customer_reviews.title: youtube and many others is great. Plays DVD's as you would expect
customer_reviews.text: This unit is affordable and packed with features. Being able to use netflix, youtube and many others is great. Plays DVD's as you would expect. The problem is that with all function and features available there is no keyboard to use the search functions and what not. Yes you can select letters one at a time with the remote but a keyboard would make this a great product. Instead I will only use this for DVD/Blueray player and use my old Logitech Revue for youtube and netflix. Sony: Get a keyboard set up!
customer_reviews.author: TIM BEGGS

customer_reviews.title: this is second one I have received. The first ...
customer_reviews.text: this is second one I have received. The first one became defective after about 1 week, and I had to return it. This new one is holding up so far. I do have a complaint about the Selection screens now used by SONY. The old version allowed you to see several choices with brief descriptions side by side or in a grid format. The new updated software interface to NETFLIX, YOUTUBE, AMAZON, etc. only allows one subject or choice to be viewed at a time. This makes it harder and takes more time to make viewing choices.
customer_reviews.author: Rev mike

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly user friendly!!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a user-friendly streaming DVD player for my mother so that she could access streaming content such as Netflix. This worked beyond my highest expectations. It was simple to set up and connect to the home wi-fi network and, more importantly, EXTREMELY easy for her to use. The Netflix home button is great!! In fact, I liked this so much that I'm thinking of buying one for my own use to replace an older, more cumbersome streaming player.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon fan

customer_reviews.title: I think the most everything about this player is excellent
customer_reviews.text: I think the most everything about this player is excellent, however it doesn't like keep the wired-in connection with the internet. Almost every time I start the player I have to reconnect to the Internet. This means usually fiddling with the ethernet cable connect. More than slightly frustrating. However, otherwise very good 3-D (if that matters to you.) EDIT - Purchased new Ethernet cable and I not longer have any problems ... upgrade to stars.
customer_reviews.author: landru141

customer_reviews.title: Buyers Beware
customer_reviews.text: broke after three months! After reading all the reviews and doing all the research this thing just ended up being junk. Bought it cause its sony, and this sort of thing is not supposed to happen! But apparently if it lasts 90 days thats good enough for them, what a joke! Powers on but never gets past boot, flashes on the screen for a second then nothing. Hardly any support online Do not buy!!! Buyers beware!!!
customer_reviews.author: Adam Hughes

customer_reviews.title: This Blu-Ray player and streaming device has excellent quality and is easy to navigate
customer_reviews.text: This Blu-Ray player and streaming device has excellent quality and is easy to navigate. The only reason not to give this product 5 stars is the overall speed of it's streaming OS. You can expect short pauses between selections; short, but longer than Roku, Apple TV, Amazon Fire TV, or Chromecast.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Flumen

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy if you want to stream Amazon Streaming Video.  It will not work. Netflix was slow but it worked.
customer_reviews.text: Performs poorly for even a cheap player. It does not do a very good job connecting to the Internet or streaming services. It drops the network often. Netflix is very slow to load. bLuRayer picture quality is O.K. But not great. Mind you I am comparing it to a $500 Oppo player, but this was a disappointing player. The Oppo handles the problem areas mentioned above just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Julian Compton

customer_reviews.title: We have had it installed for about 2 months and ...
customer_reviews.text: We have had it installed for about 2 months and it works well. Sometimes the remote takes a few tries to turn it on and off, but that is likely more our location than the player. I use it mostly to play movies from netflix. It works well to eliminate the long hdmi cord that we used to use to stream from our desktop computer. Have not played any blue ray movies yet.
customer_reviews.author: Bookworm

customer_reviews.title: A great Bluray player!
customer_reviews.text: My last Bluray player was small,but this one is even smaller! What a great design and the onscreen layout is also great.For those having trouble connecting to the internet just get in the menue to search for the internet signal and get to the last screen where you push "Start".Now go unplug your router for 15 seconds and then plug back up.when you see your router start searching push start on your Bluray player and it will find your player just find.
customer_reviews.author: Johnnie P. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Player worked fine for 2 weeks past the 1 year warranty
customer_reviews.text: Player worked fine for 2 weeks past the 1 year warranty. Randomly stopped working with a DVD stuck inside. Froze up all apps, won't do anything but whine and try to play the DVD inside while simultaneously not registering a disk to play. Disk eject will not work on remote or player. Looking for solutions to this problem online, it appears this is a common issue with this player.
customer_reviews.author: Village Electrician

customer_reviews.title: SONY is such a great name but I haven't been impressed with SONY products
customer_reviews.text: SONY is such a great name but I haven't been impressed with SONY products. Sometimes this DVD won't play a disc so I use my 3 year old Panasonic. If you want to use an on-line service like NETFLIX you have to wait for a minute while the DVD player says it's going through the DVD tray. So I have to warm it up in advance. I'll keep it until I get a better brand but won't buy SONY again.
customer_reviews.author: Draper

customer_reviews.title: Starts fast but terribly slow menu
customer_reviews.text: Should have stuck with samsung. Starts fast but terribly slow menu. Freezes up frequently and requires unplugging. Also, when scrolling thru menu, keeps resseting my tv. Never again buying sony After one year, barely works, after last Mandatory Update, none of the apps work like netflix or amazon. JUNK
customer_reviews.author: David R Murison

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased that I spent my $$$ once again wisely
customer_reviews.text: I always wanted a Sony TV and did in fact bought a 50" one just recently in time for the NFL kick-off!. I also bought the Sony BDPS5500 3D Blu-Ray Player Wi-Fi system. The two work very well 2'gether! I am very pleased that I spent my $$$ once again wisely! Mr. Kenneth "Rudy" Dawkins. . . P.S. ( An absolute way to watch My "Skins" football team!)
customer_reviews.author: kenneth R. Dawkins

customer_reviews.title: The other one works just fine.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. One of them doesn't work very well. It has trouble with staying connected to the WIFI. The sound disappears from time to time when playing DVDs, and it has had trouble playing blu-rays. The other one works just fine.
customer_reviews.author: C. Stanford

customer_reviews.title: You have to love Sony products!
customer_reviews.text: Sony never disappoints. Easy to setup and internet connections is good. Buffers the signal so when the internet gets slow the movie continues on Net Flicks. Much better than the other brand I had which had no buffer. Very reasonably priced
customer_reviews.author: PAG

customer_reviews.title: Good Got Better
customer_reviews.text: Sony created a small footprint, faster loading and finely tuned device that is a joy to use. Even homemade tape-to-DVD creations play upscale with great video and sound.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Duggan

customer_reviews.title: Sony Blu-Ray Player
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice unit, very easy to set up and use. Nothing fancy, but it does get the job done. Apparently you can only use the apps that come available with it so I was a bit disappointed about not being able to use Flixter with this unit. Still overall, I am very pleased with this unit and it's performance.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky Faurot

customer_reviews.title: Plays blu Ray and 3d as expected . Wifi speed is good . Only issue is very limited apps.
customer_reviews.text: Plays blu Ray and 3d as expected . Wifi speed is good . Only issue is very limited apps. U can't download as its sony. May b country specific (India). Did not play non USA blu Rays and dvd. Another stupid logic . When i pay for original disc y to restrict. This is where ppl just download instead of ..
customer_reviews.author: Ravz

customer_reviews.title: Winner
customer_reviews.text: Should be 4 1/2 stars cause no Google play movies. Works great so far. Amazon Prime video, 3D Netflix films, of course Sony movies and a bunch of other stuff. Internet browser is not the greatest, but it gets you to web sites.
customer_reviews.author: Dilly

customer_reviews.title: Eject button stopped working after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: I had this dvd player for 4 months when the eject button stopped working. It doesn't work when I push the button on the machine or push the button on the channel changer. The only way to get it to open and close is to unplug it and plug it back in. I am disapotointed it broke after only 4 months and the return period is only 1 month.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Myrmel

customer_reviews.title: ... player is blazing fast and the picture quality is great. It has a ton of apps and best ...
customer_reviews.text: This Blu ray player is blazing fast and the picture quality is great. It has a ton of apps and best of all is very small. The only thing I found that it was a bit tricky was to get bitstream audio for Dolby Atmos and DTS X. So don't forget to go to the system setting, select audio and the select BD Audio Mix to "Off" otherwise you won't be able to get bitstream audio, But overall is great blu ray player.
customer_reviews.author: Beyond4K

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely terrible.. Amazon should NOT be selling this.
customer_reviews.text: This is the most frustrating electronic garbage I have ever plugged in. It stops playing at random moments, disconnects itself from the wireless network on an HOURLY basis.. I could go on. Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: I like the small size
customer_reviews.text: It came in prime condition and works great. I use it to stream Amazon Prime videos and videos on my Serviio DLNA server. I now have 3 of the BDPS5100 players as well as the BDPS5500. I actually like the BDPS5500 better than the BDPS5100.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lott

customer_reviews.title: I wish I would have bought a different unit. ...
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have bought a different unit. This one is lack luster no frills and cheap looking. I will say it works as it should although seems a little slow some times.
customer_reviews.author: Rob K.

customer_reviews.title: good for disks, not for streaming
customer_reviews.text: 3 Stars for being visually pleasing, and playing blueray & dvds. -2 Stars for how bad the software is. Don't even think about using this device for streaming services like Netflix. Not only is the interface lag horrendous, but there was actually audio lag as well!
customer_reviews.author: Kaneda

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Good buy. Has worked well for more than a year.
customer_reviews.author: dalden42

customer_reviews.title: in-built channels are amazing.
customer_reviews.text: BDPS5500 servers as a 3D source for my Epson Projector and without any second thought it works perfectly. Light weight and little space occupation, in-built channels are amazing.
customer_reviews.author: OM

customer_reviews.title: I expected better from a Sony.
customer_reviews.text: Had this less than two months and it started to intermittently ignore any commands from remote including power off. Needed to unplug it to wake it up. Now it's constant and using the pause function guarantees it'll lock up so this thing is headed to electronics recycle! What a waste, what a piece of junk. Not the performance I'm used to from Sony.
customer_reviews.author: Fawkes11/5

customer_reviews.title: Best DVD Player I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a Sony BDPs5500 3D Streaming Blue-Ray Disc Player last month and I love it. I can play my old movies in real high definition thru a hdmi cable on my samsung 61" dlp tv. The sound is awesome as well. I can connect to the internet and watch online movies since I have Netflix, again awesome high definition image and sound. I can also mirror my android lg volt phone thru the the dvd player on my TV. Size is very compact and light weight. I highly recommend this dvd player. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joel A.

customer_reviews.title: Great!... But time will tell....
customer_reviews.text: I love it so far! Time will tell. I bought a new Bly player 4 months ago and all of a sudden a month ago it would not play half of my blus or DVDs and it had a high rating?!? So I hope this one doesn't gv me trouble like that. But so far it instantly plays all my blus and DVDs the old one stopped playing! I hv only had it 2 weeks but I'm highly pleased so far!
customer_reviews.author: JLR

customer_reviews.title: This is a LEMON.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy. It is very buggy. I have had multiple blu rays and pretty tech savvy. This software or firmware or boot up sequence keeps getting messed up and I have to keep pulling power cord out of wall and after 50 tInes is sometimes settles on main menu and you may get to use it. I bought in October 2015 and it's now Feb 2016 and I think it's decided not to work at all. So dissapointed. BTW it is caught up on all updates, so no savior there.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Simmons

customer_reviews.title: ... day to replace a Samsung BD player that was useless. I liked the front loaded switches that were ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this refurbished Sony the other day to replace a Samsung BD player that was useless. I liked the front loaded switches that were easy to use and obvious, unlike the Samsung which frustrated me constantly. I liked the remote a lot too. It was easy to coordinate it with my Samsung Plasma (which is a really good tv) and its layout well done and comfortable to the hand.
customer_reviews.author: George Neils

customer_reviews.title: not as bad as the Samsung I had previously
customer_reviews.text: Slow, not as bad as the Samsung I had previously, but it takes a while to load the menu and get it going. I bought this one specifically because my kids tend to lose the remote and this one allows a smart phone to work as the remote, only it doesn't have ALL the features of the remote so it was limited. They did eventually lose the remote to this one as well and the replacement is $25.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Blu Ray Player
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and quick response loading the DVDs.......User friendly. Good price and fast delivery. I would buy from this seller again. The product was just what I was looking for ...well built and easy to use, asking a good price too. Our old player didn't play the new Blu Ray movies, so this did the trick, works well.
customer_reviews.author: Curtrenton

customer_reviews.title: Really good product.
customer_reviews.text: The player arrived while we were on vacation, and I set it up this afternoon. The setup was unbelievably easy, and it appears to be working perfectly. I've played a DVD and watched a bit of Netflix. Programing the remote to operate the TV was very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Geezer37

customer_reviews.title: The only thing that had me concerned about this Blu-ray ...
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that had me concerned about this Blu-ray player was the grainy picture on Amazon Prime video streams, but then I found a forum that explained that you just have to let it play for a minute or two and then the HD picture appears. The player is very small and takes up very little space. Blu-ray disks load quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: I hate it.
customer_reviews.text: This unit is very frustrating to own. Exceptionally weak Wi-Fi reception. Very temperamental functionality. No function buttons on the unit, everything has to be done with the remote. Sometimes it doesn't want to play, or even to turn off/on or slide the tray out. All in all, I hate it.
customer_reviews.author: Hound Dog

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Blu Ray player
customer_reviews.text: Excellent Blu Ray Player, 480P & DVD up-scaling to 1080 HD is seamless Love the Screen Mirror function. I now can stream movies from Netflix from my cell phone to my TV screen when at the beach house, no need to pay for internet service there.
customer_reviews.author: Mike 27513

customer_reviews.title: Important Dolby Atmos Information
customer_reviews.text: To output HD audio (such as Dolby Atmos) to your AV receiver, make sure Options > Audio > BD Audio MIX Setting is OFF.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Very unreliable
customer_reviews.text: Takes forever to start up and connect to wifi, even trying and ethernet cable still gives slow startup and connection times. Device would freeze up often and eventually got tossed in the basement.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Almquist

customer_reviews.title: Nice player with extra streaming features
customer_reviews.text: After my PS3 died I was thinking about getting a PS4 but bought this instead. I'm happy I did. It really fulfills my main objective which was a bluray player that lets me watch Netflix and Amazon as well. It even let's me play PS3 games but you need a PS4 controller. At $59 that's a bit steep. It also would be nice to play Spotify since I could through my PS3 but for the price this is a nice player. I've had trouble with the Flixster app and occasionally it stalls out but for the most part it's doing its job. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: WiFi implementation is bad
customer_reviews.text: Every time I would use it, it would not connect to WiFi and would have to go into the WiFi setup. At first, I was entering the entire password. I realized I could just go through the setup without making any changes and it would connect. That too got old though. I used it for less than a week and went back to watching Prime Video and Netflix through a PC.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Consumer Report, CNET and Amazon all gave ++ reviews on this one.
customer_reviews.text: EASY hook up! Just plugged in to the old Blu-ray HDMI port, badda bing, works no problem. Remote is simple. Actually the WIFI hook up is better than my old LG and has better speed. This is one day in, so we will and add to the review in a few months for actual work over time..
customer_reviews.author: C. Gregory

customer_reviews.title: We bought this in March thinking this looked really easy and was very sleek looking
customer_reviews.text: We bought this in March thinking this looked really easy and was very sleek looking. It worked fine for a few months then it started acting up. Doing thinks like freezing up completely. Then today, not even 6 months after we bought it, we lost complete connectivity and could not get it to connect to the internet at all. No more streaming! Very disappointed in this player!!!!!! Beware
customer_reviews.author: Michele Gauvin

customer_reviews.title: Keeps blacking
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a family Christmas Gift for ourselves and have used it 5 times probably and it doesn't work it keeps blinking out. Had to go on line to read on other people who have had this problem. At least I was able to get my Red Box movie out by having to reset it.
customer_reviews.author: smcgrath

customer_reviews.title: on time delivery and good price.
customer_reviews.text: bought this as a birthday gift and we have not installed it yet so I really cannot give a comment on the performance, but my husband picked it out and said this is what he was looking for, so it must be alright. on time delivery and good price.
customer_reviews.author: Mary F. Manzola

customer_reviews.title: plays blurays with great resolution. Small and attractive unit
customer_reviews.text: Set up wireless in seconds, plays blurays with great resolution. Small and attractive unit. Recommend. Streams as well as our ROKU.
customer_reviews.author: Radius LLC

customer_reviews.title: Has allowed me to waste an inordinate amount of time on Netflix
customer_reviews.text: Ended up buying this after purchasing the 1500 series because I wanted the wireless capabilities. Has allowed me to waste an inordinate amount of time on Netflix:) quality product, excellent price, super fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent Blu-Ray Player.
customer_reviews.text: It's does blu-rays and DVDs and it loads pretty quick. Also "smart" so you have a bunch of titles to pick from.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Love this.
customer_reviews.text: Love how compact this blue ray player is. The only thing we don't care for is that it doesn't remember from one day to the next where we left off in a DVD. You have to start the DVD at the beginning. It was easy to hook up and use.
customer_reviews.author: JM

product_meta.title: Sony BDPS5500 3D Blu-Ray Player with Wi-Fi (2015 Model),Black
product_meta.description: Style:Blu-rayEnjoy 300+ streaming entertainment services, including Netflix, YouTube, Hulu Plus, and more. You’ll get stunning resolution thanks to TRILUMINOS technology, making your favorite 3D Blu-ray movies look better than ever. Bring your mobile media to the big screen with Miracast screen mirroring, or play select PlayStation 3 games with PlayStation Now-no game console required. Input Output Terminals: HDMI Output (1 rear), Coaxial Audio Output (1 rear), USB Input (1 front), Ethernet Connection (1 rear)
feature_bullets: 300+ streaming apps: Netflix,YouTube,Hulu Plus, Amazon Instant Video & more, Mirror your Android compatible mobile devices screen on your TV with Miracast technology, Stream and enjoy PlayStation 3 games

Full HD 1080p Blu-ray Disc playback with 2D to 3D conversion, Upscale your DVDs to near HD quality or even play your CDs, Unique to Sony, TRILUMINOS Display technology creates a heightened sense of depth
New Wi-Fi module provides excellent stability and speed for improved streaming performance, Easy access to apps and functions with a new and customizable User Interface
Control & browse from mobile devices with TV SideView, Quick Start/Load to watch movies faster than ever, Enjoy music, photos and video via front USB slot
Experience HD sound with Dolby TrueHD and dts-Master Audio, Browse the internet on your TV with the built in web browser, Energy Star 3.0 compliant

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.9 out of 5 stars737 ratings3.9 out of 5 stars
